intro: Rauvolfia sandwicensis var. typica, commonly known as Hawaiian rue or Hawaiian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as rainforests and is often found near streams or on rocky slopes. It has been traditionally used in Hawaiian medicine for its purported medicinal properties. The species is also notable for containing alkaloids, which have been studied for potential pharmaceutical applications.
